channel.title: Really Scary Error,
channel.description:
[code]client.java:19171: code too large public void parseIncomingPackets(){ ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Note: server.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
I figured this means there no more room in my client.java? If so, how do I resolve this issue?

item.title: Really Scary Error,
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Remove all the shit in your client.java

Its bound to have about 500 global objects, 100 portals, Un-needed dialogues,
Overcrowded 'Boolean process() and many more,

Basically everything in private servers apart from the basic requirements is defined as ‘Shit’.

Read full topic

item.title: Really Scary Error,
item.dc:creator: @parkview parkview
item.description:
@parkview wrote:

[quote=“xstrxpurez, post:8, topic:238811”][quote author=parkview link=topic=315067.msg2504588#msg2504588 date=1224869142]
I want an answer, not doubts. Everything is useful so. What are my options?
[/quote]
god damn… we already told you… go in your client.java search for anything that has // before it and delete it… its as simple as that… when it has // it means its nothing thats being used… just simply telling you something or telling u wat something is.[/quote]

Yes i know, but all my // (text in front) ARE deleted! and i deleted all the text between /BLA/ , yet it’s still too full… What else to do?

Read full topic

item.title: Really Scary Error,
item.dc:creator: @xstrxpurez xstrxpurez
item.description:
@xstrxpurez wrote:

parkview:

Yea, but everything is usefull, how do we make a client2.java? and make it reconize everyhing from client.java?

how about this… expand the client.java… or just delete the useless junk… such as when it says this
//blah blah blah… delete that stuff to make more room… u probably have about 2000 lines filled with that crap

Read full topic
